Parameters.desc: This is the name of the *.vrsh file which contains the precomputed SH for this scene
Reasonable when rendering animations. Depending on this option V-Ray calculates the lighting either once at the beginning of the rendering or precalculates it before every frame
Turns on the environment sampling to add environment light contribution
Depending on this option V-Ray samples either the whole sphere or only the upper hemisphere of the environment
Parameters.name: Upper hemisphere only

Parameters.desc: The square of this parameter is proportional to the number of rays, sampled in the environment

Turns on the filtering of the spherical harmonics. This is useful to reduce the ringing artifacts (known as Gibbs phenomena in signal processing) by suppressing the high frequencies. This produces blurred SH which result in a smoother image
The strength of high frequencies' suppression. Values near 0.0 slightly change the image while values near 1.0 smooth it a lot
